info.title: Item report
info.description: This API is used to generate the Item Report for DSVs. It returns all the information associated with vendor items that are set up on Walmart’s platform.

get.description: This API is used to generate the Item Report for DSVs. It returns all the information associated with vendor items that are set up on Walmart’s platform.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Use this to mention the type of report. Use type=vendor_item for fetching Item Report for DSVs

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Use this parameter(version = 2) to access the latest version of the DSV report.

productCategory.description: The category of this item. This may differ from what was suggested when the item was ingested.

publishStatus.description: Whether the item is published on Walmart.com

shipMethods.description: Shipping methods available for each item.

wpid.description: The Walmart Product ID assigned by Walmart to the item when listed on Walmart.com

gtin.description: The item's Global Trade Item Number. This may differ from what was suggested when the item was ingested.

upc.description: The item's Universal Product Code. This may differ from what was suggested when the item was ingested.

primaryCatPath.description: The primary item category path on Walmart.com.

offerStartDate.description: Date at which the item becomes visible on Walmart.com

offerEndDate.description: Date after which the item will not be visible on Walmart.com

itemCreationDate.description: The system timestamp date when an item was created.

lastUpdationDate.description: The system timestamp date when an item was updated.

itemPageUrl.description: URL for item page on walmart.com

reviewCount.description: The total number of customer reviews for the item.

averageRating.description: An average rating number for the item from customers.

productTaxCode.description: A seven-digit product tax code that identifies the amount of sales tax that should be collected for individual items.

shippingWeight.description: The weight of the item when packaged to ship.

shippingWeightUnit.description: The unit of measurement used to describe the weight of the product when packaged to ship.

availableInventoryUnits.description: The number of items in stock

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

accessToken.description: Header authentication with a Walmart access token, which is automatically generated using your Client ID and Client Secret. The token is valid for 15 minutes, and will be passed in the WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN header

consumerId.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
consumerId.description: Header authentication with your Walmart consumer ID, which is passed in the WM_CONSUMER.ID header. This is always used in tandem with signature authentication (below). When using endpoints that require consumer ID authentication, you must pass the `consumerId` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

partner.name: WM_PARTNER.ID
partner.description: Header authentication with your Walmart partner ID, which is passed in the WM_PARTNER.ID header. Required by Supplier API endpoints. When using endpoints that require partner ID authentication, you must pass the `partnerId` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

signature.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
signature.description: Request signature authentication. Request signatures are generated using a combination of request info, a timestamp, and your Walmart consumer ID and private key. The signature is passed in the WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE header. This is always used in tandem with consumer ID authentication (above). When using endpoints that require signature authentication, you must pass the `privateKey` and `consumerId` options to the `Configuration` constructor.
